Package ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.goals

Class InventoryGoal

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.goals.InventoryGoal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Goal
public class InventoryGoal extends Object implements Goal

InventoryGoal

Represents a Goal which consideres whether a Player instance holds a collection of specified items in its inventory. The class implements the Goal interface.
Since:
12.02.2023
Version:
27.02.2022
Author:
Group 24

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryGoal

      public InventoryGoal(List<String> mandatoryItems)
      Creates a new instance of InventoryGoal with the specified collection of items which a Player object needs to hold.
      Parameters:
      mandatoryItems - list of items required in order to achieve this goal.
      Throws:
      InvalidGoalException - if the list is either null or an empty list.

  • Method Details

    • isFulfilled

      public boolean isFulfilled(Player player)
      Determines whether a Player object holds the items which are required to achieve this goal in its inventory.
      Specified by:
      isFulfilled in interface Goal
      Parameters:
      player - the Player object whose inventory is considered.
      Returns:
      true if the Player holds all required items, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      InvalidGoalException - if the Player object is null.
